location: The incident occurred on an Indian Airlines flight originating in New Delhi
summary: 03/27/1993: A man claiming to have explosives hijacked a domestic Indian Airlines flight carrying 203 passengers and ordered it to fly to Pakistan. The plan was forced to instead land in Punjab, India. No injuries or casualties resulted from the incident.
addnotes: The hijacker claimed to have committed the attack to protest against the recent Hindu-Muslim violence that has killed over 2,000 Indians since December. No injuries or casualties resulted from the attack.
scite1: “Indian hijacker gives up, frees 203 on airliner,” Chicago Tribune, March 28, 1993.
scite2: “India Flight Hijacked; All 203 Aboard Are Reportedly Safe,” The Associated Press, March 27, 1993.
